snippet: The players, both 17 at the time of the episode, had been charged with aggravated sexual contact and aggravated assault; they were found guilty of two disorderly persons charges.
abstract: Two of seven Sayreville, NJ, high school football players charged in 2014 locker-room hazing and sexual abuse scandal are acquitted of all serious charges.

byline.original: By ANDY NEWMAN and JASON GRANT

lead_paragraph: The players, both 17 at the time of the episode, had been charged with aggravated sexual contact and aggravated assault; they were found guilty of two disorderly persons charges.

headline.main: 2 Sayreville Football Players Cleared of Serious Charges in Hazing Case
headline.print_headline: 2 Cleared of Main Charges in Hazing Case

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Sayreville War Memorial High School (Sayreville, NJ)
